travels.title: Wales/Iceland '14
travels.headertext: We visited Wales and Iceland in May 2014. Steve arranged the Iceland stop as a surprise 50th birthday for Rodger. We started in south Wales, then drove up to the north of Wales, came back for three days in London, then spent five days in Iceland on the way back. _LEFT_BR_RIGHT_You'll find a day-by-day description _LEFT_a href=_Q_daybyday.php?destination=WalesIceland14_Q__RIGHT_here._LEFT_/a_RIGHT_

entry.text: In south Wales, we stayed in The Mumbles near Swansea. From there, we explored the coast out at St. Davids, the Gower peninsula near Swansea and Swansea itself.
We drove up the coast to Colwyn Bay via Aberystwyth and Snowdonia National Park.
From Colwyn Bay, we explored Conwy and Snowdonia and took a restored narrow gauge railway from Caernarfon to Porthmadog. We also explored Bodnant Gardens.
We returned to London from Colwyn Bay, stopping at Shrewsbury and spending on day in Stratford-upon-Avon.
After three days in London, we flew to Iceland. Our first day was spent in Reyjavik. For the rest of the time, we stayed about 30 minutes north of Reykjavik in Mosfellsbaer.
From Mosfellsbaer, we were able to explore the Golden Circle, the Snaefellsnes peninsula and the south coast over to Vik.
